===Etymology===
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=ひざさら|膝|tr1=hiza|t1=knee|皿|tr2=sara|t2=plate}}, from the shape of the bone.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

Also encountered with the reading ''hizazara''.  {{rendaku2|sort=ひざざら|sara|zara}}<ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref><ref name="DJS">{{R:Daijisen}}</ref><ref name="SMK5">{{R:Shinmeikai5}}</ref>

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|ひざさら|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR,SMK5}}
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|ひざざら|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR,SMK5}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|ひざ さら}}

# {{lb|ja|anatomy|sort=ひざさら}} The [[kneecap]], the [[patella]].

====Usage notes====
Both {{m|ja|膝の皿|tr=hiza no sara}} and {{m|ja|膝皿|tr=hiza sara}} are in use in modern Japanese, with {{m|ja|膝の皿|tr=hiza no sara}} used more frequently. The term {{m|ja|膝蓋骨|tr=shitsugaikotsu}} is somewhat more technical, a bit like English {{m|en|patella}} compared to {{m|en|kneecap}}.

====Synonyms====
* {{ja-r|膝蓋骨|しつがいこつ}}
* {{ja-r|膝の皿|ひざのさら}}
* {{ja-r|膝頭|ひざがしら}}
